title: Kammerspiele Theater Typeface in Berlin Germany
content:
Can anyone idenitfy this typeface is on the facade of the Kammerspiele Des Deutschen Theaters in Berlin? Even something similar would help. Thanks-

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020650im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KammerspieleType_3466.jpg)
author: jsueda

comments.content:
Seems very close to Jim Parkinson's [Azuza](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020650/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/azuza/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D52%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DKAMMERSPIELE%2520DEUTSCHEN%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D23) from 2001. However, as I look more, the counters on your lettering seem a bit more squared, like something of Zapf's.

- Mike Yanega

The K in Melior isn't the same, but I agree that the rest looks good.

- Mike Yanega
Yes, you are right, Mike. Another similar typeface would be [Liberation Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020650/http:/www.identifont.com/show?LNZ), which has a better K …

Interesting. It's part of a free font set by Red Hat. A new Serif Font Guide addition.

- Mike Yanega
Oh, as far as I know it is related to [Ascender Serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020650/http:/www.identifont.com/show?LXX).

Yes, as far as the Roman samples on Identifont, they look identical. In any case, I now have Liberation Serif in the Guide, since it was a free font and I could download the family of 4 fonts. Full sample from the Serif Guide shown below. Thanks Renko.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130303020650im_/http:/typophile.com/files/liberation_serif_full_5205.gif)
